content.text: The lake itself is more dingy up close. The water almost is sparkly, from the few glimpses you catch before staring back at your boots.
Along the lefthand side of the shore, you can see old, dilapidated buildings, rotting and crushed under time's weight.
Looking to the righthand side, you see glimpses of glimmering... objects, maybe, in the trees, glinting off the sunlight.
The shore itself also isn't barren of items. You can see strange objects and lumps in the dirt and sediment.
